DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Immunoglobulin Heavy Chain Locus Variable Region Mutation Performed Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The status for information related to the laboratory procedure for immunoglobulin heavy chain variable region gene (igVH) mutation.  A change in the nucleotide sequence of the variable region of the immunoglobulin heavy chain locus.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Immunoglobulin Heavy Chain Locus Variable Region Mutation Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the laboratory procedure for immunoglobulin heavy chain variable region gene (igVH) mutation.  A change in the nucleotide sequence of the variable region of the immunoglobulin heavy chain locus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Immunoglobulin Heavy Chain Locus Variable Region Mutation Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the variable region of the immunoglobulin heavy chain locus.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.longName: Immunoglobulin Heavy Chain Locus Variable Region Mutation
Concepts.definition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the variable region of the immunoglobulin heavy chain locus.
Executed and carried through to completion.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mutated (greater than or equal to two percent)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mutated (greater than or equal to two percent)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: To undergo or cause genetic mutation.
